               Plate VI
Structure of Disks of Complex Type, as Shown in Vertical Sections.

1. Inner margin of a zone of a thin fossil disk, showing
the fissures leading to its columnar cells:- 100 diam.
2. The same, from a somewhat thicker disk:- 100 diam.
3. Radial section of a recent disk, showing <s>the</s> a complete
development on the normal type; <u>aa</u>, <u>bb</u>, upper and
lower superficial layers; <u>c,c,c,c</u>, intermediate stratum;
<u>dd,d'd',d"d"</u>, summits of partitions between successive zones,
forming the floors of the <s>sul</s> superficial cells; <u>e,e',e"</u>, <s>an-
nular canals of three zones, lying beneath</s> oblique passages through the floors of the cells of the superficial
<s>cells of the upper</s> layer, leading towards the annular canals; <u>f,f',f",f'"</u>, an-
nular canals of four zones, near the lower surface of the
disk; <u>gg</u>, partitions between the adjacent cells of the same
